alert.note: Alert for Caldwell; Trigg (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 14 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of western Kentucky, including the following counties, Caldwell and Trigg. * WHEN...Until 900 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 658 PM CDT, Trained weather spotters reported heavy rain in the advisory area due to thunderstorms, close to 3.5 inches. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Stillhouse Branch, Cantrell Creek, Horse Creek, Eddy Creek, Skinframe Creek, and Sinking Fork. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Cerulean. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
